The dialog is shown when I type ctrl+v to paste some text

The dialog is shown when I type ctrl+v to paste some text

Please do not set target... As its title says, this is the target milestone in which developer intends to put the fix.

Saying that, can you try to give a more detailed scenario to help to reproduce (eclipse version you're using: 3.0, 3.0.1 or  3.0.2, CU you were editing, text you were pasting, etc.)? Copy/Paste works in 3.0 versions otherwise we should have bugs on this failure before... So, there's surely something special you're trying to do which makes this problem happen and we must know exactly what to be able to reproduce, understand and fix it.

Move to JDT/Text for further investigation when detailed sceanrio will be there...

The code in question does something like A_STRING_CONSTANT.equals(someOtherValue) which can't throw an NPE. Might be a VM / JIT bug.

If you still see this using 3.2M4 or newer then please reopen with steps to reproduce and include the VM you're using.

See also:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/bug-incomplete.htm

This error is shown when I use Websphere Integration Development(WID). But I guess it is an eclipse defect. When I re-create a workspace, it can work now. I even don't know how to reproduce it. 
Again, the eclipse version is 3.0.2.
